intro: Myrsine arfakensis, commonly known as the Arfak myrsine, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and have a smooth surface. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species in botanical research.
